titleStmt.title: Celia's complaint, for the loss of her virginity. She by fair words was quickly won, Amintas prov'd unkind; and Celia says, she's quite undone, much troubled in her mind. To the tune of, Philander

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Charles Passenger, at the Seven Stars on London-Bridge.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library and the British Library.
